title: Venezuela Military Invasion - 'We're Going to Run the Country'
summary: January 3, 2026: Trump announced U.S. military operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro using 'overwhelming military power, air land and sea' to 'launch a spectacular assault' against 'heavily fortified military fortress in the heart of Caracas.' Venezuelan civilians and service members killed. Trump stated: 'We're going to run the country until such time as we can do a safe, proper and judicious transition.' Did not notify Congress - violates War Powers Resolution. Chatham House: May be 'the moment when Western Europe realizes that the U.S. has abandoned the core values.' Sen. Warner: 'Does this mean any large country can indict the ruler of a smaller adjacent country and take that person out?' Critics call it neo-colonialism and resource extraction disguised as anti-drug operation.
keyFacts: January 3, 2026: Trump announced U.S. military operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro
Described 'extraordinary military operation' using 'overwhelming military power, air land and sea' to 'launch a spectacular assault'
Venezuelan casualties: Both civilians and service members killed; large part of Maduro's security team killed
Maduro charged with drug trafficking and narco-terrorism conspiracies by AG Pam Bondi
Trump stated: 'We're in charge' when asked who is running Venezuela
'We're going to run the country until such time as we can do a safe, proper and judicious transition'
U.S. plans to govern Venezuela with no clear timeline or exit strategy
Trump: Operation 'won't cost us anything' because U.S. oil companies would invest, 'It's going to make a lot of money'
Administration serving 'triple goals of crippling Maduro, hitting drug trade routes and getting access to Venezuela oil'
Administration expressed interest in Venezuela's large deposits of gold and rare earth minerals
Critics call it neo-colonialism and resource extraction disguised as anti-drug operation
Did not notify Congress in advance - bucks laws and precedents requiring Congressional notification
Chatham House: May be 'the moment when Western Europe realizes that the U.S. has abandoned the core values that united them for the past century'
Sen. Mark Warner (D): 'Does this mean any large country can indict the ruler of a smaller adjacent country and take that person out?'
Setting dangerous international precedent for military interventions
Trump dismissed María Corina Machado (2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner) as 'very nice woman' who 'doesn't have the support'
Trump suggested partnering with Maduro loyalist Delcy Rodríguez as interim president instead
CNN: 'Trump doesn't seem interested in working with Venezuela's opposition'

sources.text: NPR: 'We are going to run the country,' Trump says after strike on Venezuela
NPR: Trump says U.S. will 'run' Venezuela and sell seized oil in remarks on the strikes
NBC News: Trump says U.S. will govern Venezuela until there's a 'proper transition'
Wikipedia: 2026 United States intervention in Venezuela
